titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mario Lombardo Scores MC.284
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-11 08:31:07 -0500.

physdesc.extent: in 5 record cartons, 2 small flat boxes, and 1 oversize flat box

did.abstract: Mario Lombardo (1930-2010) was an American composer based in New Jersey. Lombardo earned a Master's degree in English from Seton Hall University, where he also served as a professor. In the course of his professional career, Lombardo composed more than 200 songs, six musicals, and numerous works for chorus, orchestras, and specific instrumentations, many of which were performed by the orchestras both domestically and internationally. This collection consists of musical scores in various stages for Lombardo's compositions, including notebooks, drafts on staff paper, arrangements for specific parts, study scores, condensed scores, full scores, and sheet music. Works present in the collection include Variations in a Mod Mood, Drakestail, Serenade for Violin and Orchestra, Three Psalms of David, Blue Interlude, Near Nostalgia, and Late Autumn, in addition to other pieces for orchestra, piano, tenor voice, oboe, and violin.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of musical scores in various stages for the compositions of Mario Lombardo, including notebooks, drafts on staff paper, arrangements for specific parts, study scores, condensed scores, full scores, and sheet music. Works present in the collection include Variations in a Mod Mood, Drakestail, Serenade for Violin and Orchestra, Three Psalms of David, Blue Interlude, Near Nostalgia, and Late Autumn, in addition to other pieces for orchestra, piano, tenor voice, oboe, and violin.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mario Lombardo (1930-2010) was an American composer based in New Jersey. Lombardo earned a Master's degree in English from Seton Hall University, where he also served as a professor. He was a member of the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers (ASCAP), and was named the 1994 Musician of the Year by the New Jersey Conference of Musicians. In the course of his professional career, Lombardo composed more than 200 songs, six musicals, and numerous works for chorus, orchestras, and specific instrumentations, many of which were performed by the orchestras both domestically and internationally.
Cranford Chronicle. "Obituaries: Mario Lombardo, 80, Composed for Orchestras." http://www.nj.com/cranford/index.ssf/2012/01/obituaries_mario_lombardo_80_c.html (retrieved November 21, 2017).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Mario Lombardo, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Laura Szpir, Mario Lombardo's daughter, in September 2014; the accession number associated with this gift is 2017.052.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Mario Lombardo Scores; MC 284; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Original order is unknown.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the point of transfer to the archives, materials were rehoused in archival boxes according to size. During accessioning, materials were described on the collection-level with a box- and folder-list.
